content: generations short socks these warm and fluffy socks are inspired by countless generations of knitters who have been using basic patterns in contrasting colours to create unique beautiful and practical knitwear i love the traditional diamond shapes which have been used for hundreds possibly over a thousand years as evidenced by some very old preserved pieces of knitting ​ although created using a different technique to the knitting we know today these basic patterns have been adopted and adapted by knitting cultures all over the world uniting the knitting community through time and across geographies i hope you will feel this connectedness to other knitters when you work these socks the generations short socks are worked cuff down in an aran weight yarn using double pointed needles the pattern is sized for eu 37-39 uk 4-6 / us 6-8 for any questions or comments please feel free to contact me on invisiblepinkuni@gmail com or @invisiblepinkuni on instagram i would love it if you use ​ ​ ​ #generationssocks if you share pictures of your socks i hope you will enjoy knitting the generations short socks © karola rehnström 2021 all rights reserved - for personal use only version 1 1 20210131 page 1 of 5 #generationssocks general info size this pattern knitted using the gauge below will result in a eu 37-39 uk 4-6 / us 6-8 sock the foot can easily be adjusted by adding/decreasing row to fit a shorter or longer foot yarn the pattern is designed for an aran weight yarn approx 100g = 200m/218 yds i like a wool blend for durability a different yarn composition may alter the amount of yarn needed this pattern has been tested with novita 7 veljestä 75% wool and 25% polyamide 100g=200m and viking of norway sportsragg 60% wool 20% nylon 20% acrylic 100g=200m the image above is knitted in novita 7 veljestä white 011 and 7 veljestä nostalgia luumu 79 you will need approx 80-95g 160-190m/175-208 yds of the main colour and 30-40g 60-80m/65-87yds of the contrast colour the cuff heel and foot are worked in the main colour and the toe in the contrast colour the amount of yarn depends on your knitting gauge and the exact yarn you use and therefore may be different needles you will need five 3 5mm us 4 double pointed needles you may need a different size always use the size to give you the desired gauge you may also need a cable needle if that s your preference for working the left leaning twist over 2 stitches in the cuff gauge note if your gauge differs from the below your socks will be a different size if your gauge is tighter more stitches per 10cm/4″ your socks will be smaller than indicated and if your gauge is looser less stitches per 10cm/4″ your socks will be bigger than indicated the pattern is designed for a gauge of 23 stitches and 26 row/10cm 4″ using two colours and 22 stitches and 29
